1569200371_16PfVSZrUZuwTgs7wBt1t3ZK9rsvd.body: And I'm now forced to switch to my KxoID cause my ZeroID is 1 character away from 50K/50K. xD The limit is so low. Especially considering that upvoting/liking posts/comments also takes a pretty big amount of space too.

> [randomshits](#comment_157_1CuFETj5LtyEduzaoAcdv9sMAQtYRqjqDY): I agree it is too small of a limit for the main landing forum of Zeronet but it is ultimately nofish's decision.It seems to me he never wanted ZeroTalk to be the landing page for 202 philosophical questions  or a publication of racial power or even political movements, but one that was here to help and direct other users to expanding the network with their own creative sites and interactions. Hence the piles of "How do i get my site going" or 'please seed my site' conversations. [...]

Yup, I believe that was his goal, the problem is, there isn't a large enough adoption of Zeronet at the moment to justify splitting the population in different forums.

> [xcape2net](#comment_412_1GJc2vm4vJjAKsFoFJ2D3gGmKiRac2kfnz): Another solution that I found accidentally is to clone ZeroTalk and create your own website.  Anything you post to your website appears in ZeroTalk, unless you take steps for it not to.  You set your own limit on your own website.

That sounds like it shouldn't work at all though?

> [xcape2net](#comment_414_1GJc2vm4vJjAKsFoFJ2D3gGmKiRac2kfnz): You would think.  But it does.

Odd. That makes me think. ZeroTalk really ought to be a merger site tbh.
